_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The accidental release and prevention emergency response policies at our facility: This facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LP-Gas storage, and it is our policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws. If any emergency were to occur, it is our policy to notify the Williston Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Description of this facility and the regulated substances handled: This facility has (2) 30,000 gallons storage tanks in which propane and anhydrous ammonia are stored for delivery to customers.
The tanks, piping and all valves are located with a secure fenced area. The delivery trucks and all nurse tanks and propane tanks are also secure.

Accidental release prevention steps taken: The facility is constantly being monitored for any faulty equipment that needs to be repaired or replaced. A training program is given at the beginning of the anhydrous season covering safety when handling anhydrous at all stages. The propane part is monitored and closely watched daily for any changes. This facility complies with EPA?s accident prevention rule and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The propane system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and State laws. The anhydrous ammonia system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with ANSI. State law has required that nurse tanks in the area be locked to prevent any illegal use of anhydrous.

Five-year accident history: This facility has had no accidents involving either propane or anhydrous, that have caused deaths, injuries to humans or animals, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.

Emergency Response Program:  In the event of an emergency involving our propane or anhydrous system, it is our policy to notify the Williston Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with Emergency Management Department and the Fire Department

. 

Planned changes to Improve Safety: We will continue to require those handling both propane and anhydrous ammonia to take the necessary training made available to them and to obey all the Federal, State and Local Laws. Any faulty equipment will be replaced and inspections will be made regularly to maintain the safety of the environment and  people in the surrounding community.
